To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Part 1 of Mutual Broadcasting System program American Eagle In Britain, broadcast in arrangement with the British Broadcasting Corporation. Possibly originally broadcast February 24, 1945 (unconfirmed, based on information on torn label and content on other side of disc). Featuring interviews conducted by Cecil Madden and Major Ken Treadwell on location at Dunker's Den of the American Red Cross Rainbow Corner Club in London, England; and Bebe Daniels on location at the 97th General Hospital, England. Features music by the Gremlins/Gremlin Orchestra, under the direction of Lieutenant George Puig (spelling unconfirmed), with conductor Sergeant Tom Frank.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
